{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3137321,"name":"Cameron Williams ","username":"Cameron_Williams","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-01T00:02:11.409Z","cooked":"

Recently, my team has been attempting to get PathPlanner to run a basic path. When we engage in autonomous, our robot turns and goes straight forward. When we rotated the gyro in code, we noticed that the angle the robot turned to changed, so, we believe the issue is the gyro.

Here are pictures of our setup as well as a video showing our issues.

A link to our code

We were wondering if anyone else has experienced this, or if anyone had insight into how we could resolve this?

our code was doing something similar. We’re using the wpilib built in pathweaver tool instead of pathplanner though. I’m not exactly sure why this is happening. I’ve been debugging for a few days now. This is my code if it helps: Elliot Scher / 2815 Robot 2023 · GitLab

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-01T00:07:34.620Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":70.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":425289,"topic_slug":"robot-turns-strangely-with-pathplanner","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://gitlab.com/ecscher84/2815-robot-2023","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Elliot Scher / 2815 Robot 2023 · GitLab","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/robot-turns-strangely-with-pathplanner/425289/2","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3137330,"name":"Cameron Williams ","username":"Cameron_Williams","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-01T00:14:29.505Z","cooked":"

Thank you, I see that you’re resetting the gyro with the current expected heading at the start of the trajectory, I’ll have to try that at my next meeting.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-01T00:14:29.505Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":37.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425289,"topic_slug":"robot-turns-strangely-with-pathplanner","display_username":"Cameron Williams ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49423,"username":"Gandagorn","name":"Elliot Scher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45964,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Semi involved Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/robot-turns-strangely-with-pathplanner/425289/3","custom_user_title":"Semi involved Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3137333,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-01T00:17:45.905Z","cooked":"

Sadly, it currently isn’t working the way we expect it to. I’ve gotten it to run correctly with a simple straight path but as soon as I add curves it all falls apart. Let me know how your team fares with this. I saw that you’re using a NavX so you may have more luck than us. We’re using an ADIS16470 from analogdevices currently.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-01T00:17:45.905Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":115.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425289,"topic_slug":"robot-turns-strangely-with-pathplanner","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":45964,"username":"Cameron_Williams","name":"Cameron Williams ","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/9e8a1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/robot-turns-strangely-with-pathplanner/425289/4","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3137336,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-01T00:23:11.461Z","cooked":"

I believe the navX is clockwise positive by default, but the path following commands/kinematics etc need the rotation to be counter clockwise positive. Try negating the angle in your getRotation method.

You also shouldn’t need to reset your gyro if you reset your odometry/pose estimator.

Thank you, in the code currently the navx is inverted, I will remove the reseting of the gyro. https://github.com/3492PARTs/PARTSlib2023/blob/features/trajectories/PARTS/frc/Utils/Interfaces/beanieDriveTrain.java

Is it inverted? This is what your getRotation method returns:

return new Rotation2d(Math.toRadians(getAngle()));

Edit: NVM, I see that the new link is different

Today we attempted to recalibrate our gyro and we also made sure that our gyro was properly inverted and our robot continued to display the strange behavior.

We ended up solving our issue, we accidentally left test code running that was making sure drive volts made both sides go the same direction.
